keyMoments.title: Momonosuke Appears in Dragon Form
keyMoments.description: Momonosuke introduces himself to Luffy while trapped in his pink dragon form in the garbage dump beneath Building C.
keyMoments.significance: The debut of Kozuki Momonosuke, future Shogun of Wano and key ally to the Straw Hats. First appearance only shows his dragon form.

keyMoments.title: Refuses Caesar's Candy
keyMoments.description: Despite extreme hunger, Momonosuke refuses to eat the drugged candy offered by Caesar Clown, citing his warrior's pride.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Momonosuke's samurai honor and strong moral character even as a child. This decision saves him from addiction but leads to eating the Devil Fruit.
keyMoments.quote: A warrior does not accept food from the enemy!

keyMoments.title: Consumes Vegapunk's Artificial Devil Fruit
keyMoments.description: Starving after ten days without food, Momonosuke eats a strange pink fruit he discovers, which transforms him into a dragon.
keyMoments.significance: Momonosuke gains the power of Vegapunk's artificial Azure Dragon fruit, giving him abilities similar to Kaido's Uo Uo no Mi.

abilities.description: Transforms into a pink dragon with yellow mane, though initially unable to control the transformation.

relationships.description: Luffy discovers Momonosuke in the garbage dump and begins to befriend the frightened dragon child.

evolutionMoments.description: Luffy and Momonosuke meet for the first time in the waste container.

reveals.information: Name revealed as Momonosuke, appears as a small pink dragon
Ate Vegapunk's artificial Devil Fruit and gained dragon transformation powers
Was captured and held in Caesar's facility, refused drugged candy, and ate the fruit out of desperation

keyMoments.title: Steps Up to Fight Monet
keyMoments.description: After Monet wounds Robin, Zoro volunteers to fight the Logia user, recognizing the need for someone who can handle her snow powers.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up one of Zoro's most memorable displays of intimidation and understanding of when to use Haki.
keyMoments.quote: I'll handle this. She's a Logia user.

keyMoments.title: Wounded by Monet's Ice Pick
keyMoments.description: Robin is stabbed in the arm by Monet's ice pick attack, demonstrating the danger of Monet's Logia powers.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Robin's vulnerability to Logia users and prompts Zoro's intervention.

keyMoments.title: Battle Against Vergo Intensifies
keyMoments.description: Smoker fights desperately against Vergo in the SAD Room, struggling against his former superior's overwhelming Haki mastery.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the power gap between Smoker and elite Haki users, showing Vergo's true strength as a Donquixote Pirates operative.

keyMoments.title: Demon Bamboo Attack Revealed
keyMoments.description: Vergo demonstrates his signature Demon Bamboo (Oni Take) technique, coating his bamboo staff with advanced Armament Haki.
keyMoments.significance: First display of Vergo's signature weapon technique, showcasing his mastery of Haki-enhanced combat.
keyMoments.quote: Let me show you true Haki mastery!

abilities.description: Vergo coats his bamboo staff with Armament Haki, making it incredibly hard and capable of shattering weapons.

keyMoments.title: Confrontation with Zoro Begins
keyMoments.description: Monet creates a deadly blizzard and wounds Robin, prompting Zoro to step forward to battle her.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the upcoming battle between Zoro and Monet, one of the arc's key confrontations.

keyMoments.title: Stabs Robin with Ice Pick
keyMoments.description: Monet transforms her arm into an ice pick and stabs Robin, demonstrating her Logia abilities and combat ruthlessness.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Monet's willingness to use lethal force and the danger of her Yuki Yuki no Mi powers.
